Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres above two faded white bands; top of lip glazed; exterior: row of dots at rim above key maeander band between pairs of dilte lines; below, painted decoration consisting of bull (part of back remaining) to left; pendant triangle and rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the pattern decoration on the bull's back, see Lemos 1991, 35, fig. 19, no. 643 from Delos.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 261, no. 525)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0470) (phase 2)
